gw.api.database

Interface BooleanExpression<T extends Bean>


  • public interface BooleanExpression<T extends Bean>
    Class used to hold (and contain) a boolean operation. This class should be overriden and the "execute" method implemented. The execute method is called with a new restriction. All operations on that expression will operate in terms of the condition this expression was passed in to. For example: xxx.or(new BooleanExpression() { public void execute(Restriction restriction) { restriction.compare("A", Equals, 10); restriction.compare("A", Equals, 20); restriction.compare("A", Equals, 30); } }); Will find all things that have (A=10 or A=20 or A=30)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void execute(Restriction<T> restriction)
      Called to add predicates to the given restriction.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        void execute(Restriction<T> restriction)
        Called to add predicates to the given restriction. All operations on that expression will operate in terms of the condition this expression was passed in to. For example: xxx.or(new BooleanExpression() { public void execute(Restriction restriction) { restriction.compare("A", Equals, 10); restriction.compare("A", Equals, 20); restriction.compare("A", Equals, 30); } }); Will find all things that have (A=10 or A=20 or A=30)
        Parameters:
        restriction - the restriction to add predicates to
